pr_title: feat(griffin) - Add support for to_lowercase and to_uppercase (feat #668)

timeline.message: feat(griffin) - Add support for to_lowercase and to_uppercase

timeline.bodyText:
thank you for the contribution! Much appreciated!
It would be good to also implement getStrLen(). Although the default implementation will work it would be less efficient than retrieving string length without printing uppercase characters to sink
timeline.author: bluestreak01

timeline.bodyText: This implementation is needlessly allocating. Calls to this method are made from function, that has local CharSink already. String instantiation is not required.
timeline.author: bluestreak01

timeline.bodyText:
The ascii uppercase method is insufficient. You should use
Character.toUpperCase()

it is more generic but slower.
Same things apply to "lowercase"
timeline.author: bluestreak01

timeline.bodyText: it would also be good to have test for non-ascii characters
timeline.author: bluestreak01

timeline.bodyText:
toLowerCaseAscii() is used elsewhere, where only ascii characters allowed. We need to keep implementation unchanged.  The SQL to_lowercase() should call Character.toLowerCase() directly.
Calling Character.toLowerCase() from toLowerCaseAscii() is also misleading, because implementation is no longer "ascii" specific.
timeline.author: bluestreak01

replies.bodyText:
As Character.toLowerCase() is a superset of what the toLowercaseAscii(char) was doing I thought it was ok just to call it inside toLowercaseAscii(char).
I'll create new methods toUppercase(...) and toLowercase(...) to use Character.toUpperCase() and Character.toLowerCase() respectively.
replies.author: upsidedownsmile

timeline.author: mpsq

timeline.message: Rebase and fix typo in the class name

timeline.author: bluestreak01

replies.bodyText: As we are trying to have as few method calls as possible then I will remove the methods toUpperCase(char) and toLowerCase(char) and call the respective Character methods directly.
